Description: Pottery ostracon: fragment of the body of a pale red-orange pottery vessel. The fabric is grey in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of five lines of black-painted hieratic text, mentioning the document of Iya. It is a letter or business memorandum.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G.Brunton, 'Matmar' (London, 1948), pp.67 and 72, mentioned only ('among the rubbish from houses in the temple area').
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393592) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393592)
